track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
101 Hack contest is back with its May edition! It's all about speed, accuracy and efficiency. Inside the contest are 5 challenges. You have exactly 120 minutes to solve them. Every second counts. 

HackerRank invites you to join the contest to compete against hackers from across the globe.
primary_contest.name: 101 Hack May

model.name: Sherlock and Array
model.php_template:
<?php

$handle = fopen ("php://stdin", "r");
function solve($a){
    // Complete this function
}

fscanf($handle, "%d",$T);
for($a0 = 0; $a0 < $T; $a0++){
    fscanf($handle, "%d",$n);
    $a_temp = fgets($handle);
    $a = explode(" ",$a_temp);
    $a = array_map('intval', $a);
    $result = solve($a);
    echo $result . "\n";
}

?>
model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    t_temp <- getLine
    let t = read t_temp :: Int
    forM_ [1..t] $ \a0  -> do
        n_temp <- getLine
        let n = read n_temp :: Int
        a_temp <- getLine
        let a = map read $ words a_temp :: [Int]


getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Check whether there exists an element in the array such that sum of elements on its left is equal to the sum of elements on its right.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          T_t (read-line) 
          T (Integer/parseInt T_t) 
        ]

      (
        loop [a0 T]
        (when (> a0 0)

          (
            let [
              n_t (read-line) 
              n (Integer/parseInt n_t) 
            ]
          )

          (
            let [
              a_temp (read-line) 
              a_t (split a_temp #"\s+") 
              a (map #(Integer/parseInt %) a_t) 
            ]
          )

        (recur (- a0 1) ) )
      )

)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [T]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
    T_list = lists:seq(1,T),
    lists:foreach( fun(T0) ->
            { ok, [N]} = io:fread("", "~d"),
            A = read_array(N,"~d")
    end,T_list),
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
model.lua_template:
function solve(a)
    -- Complete this function

T = io.read("*number", "*l")
a0 = 0
while a0 < T do
    n = io.read("*number", "*l")
    a = {}
    a_temp = io.read()
    a_i = 1;
    for token in string.gmatch(a_temp, "[^%s]+") do
    	a[a_i] = token
    	a_i = a_i + 1
    end
    a0 = a0 + 1
end
